parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate or party.  It promotes a platform ("Eu cu cine votez?") designed to help voters determine which party aligns with their values. While this indirectly relates to the election, it doesn't endorse or discourage voting for any particular candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message is clearly intended to reach a broad audience of Romanian voters.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post is not to influence voters to choose a specific candidate or party. Instead, it aims to encourage informed voting by providing a tool to help voters understand their political preferences.  The platform itself is neutral and doesn't promote any particular political agenda.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of public service announcement or citizen journalism, aiming to educate voters and promote informed participation in the democratic process. It provides a resource (the "Eu cu cine votez?" platform) for voters to research and make informed decisions.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; rather, it presents a tool for voters to engage in self-reflection and research.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1993261501182666</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a non-partisan platform designed to help voters make informed choices during the parliamentary elections.  It does not endorse or discourage voting for any specific candidate or party. The platform's neutrality, combined with the post's focus on encouraging informed voting, suggests it does not constitute electoral propaganda as defined by Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015. While the post is related to the elections, its purpose is to facilitate voter education, not to influence the outcome in favor of a particular candidate or party.  The post does not violate Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 because it does not directly refer to a specific candidate or party, and its objective is not to influence the vote for a specific candidate.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>DifinePR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
